 410  INGRES_USE_UNICODE_STRING_TYPES=True 
 411  if INGRES_USE_UNICODE_STRING_TYPES: 
 412      """convert type VARCHAR -> NVARCHAR, i.e. use UCS2/UTF16 support/storage 
 413      leaving as VARCHAR means need to use UTF8 encoding. 
 414      Some people are very passionate about which encoding 
 415      to use for storage, this gives the option. 
 416      """ 
 417      for x in ['string', 'password', 'text']: 
 418          SQL_DIALECTS['ingres'][x] = 'N' + SQL_DIALECTS['ingres'][x]

 420 -def sqlhtml_validators(field): 

 421      """ 
 422      Field type validation, using web2py's validators mechanism. 
 423   
 424      makes sure the content of a field is in line with the declared 
 425      fieldtype 
 426      """ 
 427      field_type, field_length = field.type, field.length 
 428      if isinstance(field_type, SQLCustomType): 
 429          if hasattr(field_type,'validator'): 
 430              return field_type.validator 
 431          else: 
 432              field_type = field_type.type 
 433      elif not isinstance(field_type,str): 
 434          return [] 
 435      requires=[] 
 436      if field_type == 'string': 
 437          requires.append(validators.IS_LENGTH(field_length)) 
 438      elif field_type == 'text': 
 439          requires.append(validators.IS_LENGTH(2 ** 16)) 
 440      elif field_type == 'password': 
 441          requires.append(validators.IS_LENGTH(field_length)) 
 442      elif field_type == 'double': 
 443          requires.append(validators.IS_FLOAT_IN_RANGE(-1e100, 1e100)) 
 444      elif field_type == 'integer': 
 445          requires.append(validators.IS_INT_IN_RANGE(-1e100, 1e100)) 
 446      elif field_type[:7] == 'decimal': 
 447          requires.append(validators.IS_DECIMAL_IN_RANGE(-10**10, 10**10)) 
 448      elif field_type == 'date': 
 449          requires.append(validators.IS_DATE()) 
 450      elif field_type == 'time': 
 451          requires.append(validators.IS_TIME()) 
 452      elif field_type == 'datetime': 
 453          requires.append(validators.IS_DATETIME()) 
 454      elif field._db and field_type[:9] == 'reference' and \ 
 455              field_type.find('.')<0 and \ 
 456              field_type[10:] in field._db.tables: 
 457          referenced = field._db[field_type[10:]] 
 458          if hasattr(referenced,'_format') and referenced._format: 
 459              def f(r,id): 
 460                  row=r[id] 
 461                  if not row: 
 462                      return id 
 463                  elif isinstance(r._format,str): 
 464                      return r._format % row 
 465                  else: 
 466                      return r._format(row) 

 467              field.represent = lambda id, r=referenced, f=f: f(r,id) 
 468              requires = validators.IS_IN_DB(field._db,referenced.id, 
 469                                             referenced._format) 
 470              if field.unique: 
 471                  requires._and = validators.IS_NOT_IN_DB(field._db,field) 
 472              return requires 
 473      if field.unique: 
 474          requires.insert(0,validators.IS_NOT_IN_DB(field._db,field)) 
 475      sff=['in','do','da','ti','de'] 
 476      if field.notnull and not field_type[:2] in sff: 
 477          requires.insert(0,validators.IS_NOT_EMPTY()) 
 478      elif not field.notnull and field_type[:2] in sff and requires: 
 479          requires[-1]=validators.IS_EMPTY_OR(requires[-1]) 
 480      return requires

 482 -def sql_represent(obj, fieldtype, dbname, db_codec='UTF-8'): 

 483      if type(obj) in (types.LambdaType, types.FunctionType): 
 484          obj = obj() 
 485      if isinstance(obj, (Expression, Field)): 
 486          return obj 
 487      if isinstance(fieldtype, SQLCustomType): 
 488          return fieldtype.encoder(obj) 
 489      if obj is None: 
 490          return 'NULL' 
 491      if obj == '' and not fieldtype[:2] in ['st','te','pa','up']: 
 492          return 'NULL' 
 493      if fieldtype == 'boolean': 
 494          if dbname == 'mssql': 
 495              if obj and not str(obj)[0].upper() == 'F': 
 496                  return '1' 
 497              else: 
 498                  return '0' 
 499          else: 
 500              if obj and not str(obj)[0].upper() == 'F': 
 501                  return "'T'" 
 502              else: 
 503                  return "'F'" 
 504      if fieldtype[0] == 'i': 
 505          return str(int(obj)) 
 506      if fieldtype[:7] == 'decimal': 
 507          return str(obj) 
 508      elif fieldtype[0] == 'r': # reference 
 509          if fieldtype.find('.')>0: 
 510              return repr(obj) 
 511          elif isinstance(obj, (Row, Reference)): 
 512              return str(obj['id']) 
 513          return str(int(obj)) 
 514      elif fieldtype == 'double': 
 515          return repr(float(obj)) 
 516      if isinstance(obj, unicode): 
 517          obj = obj.encode(db_codec) 
 518      if fieldtype == 'blob': 
 519          obj = base64.b64encode(str(obj)) 
 520          if dbname == 'db2': 
 521              return "BLOB('%s')" % obj 
 522          if dbname == 'oracle': 
 523              return ":CLOB('%s')" % obj 
 524      # FIXME: remove comment lines? 
 525      #elif fieldtype == 'text': 
 526      #    if dbname == 'oracle': 
 527      #        return ":CLOB('%s')" % obj.replace("'","?") ### FIX THIS 
 528      elif fieldtype == 'date': 
 529          # FIXME: remove comment lines? 
 530          # if dbname=='postgres': return "'%s'::bytea" % obj.replace("'","''") 
 531   
 532          if isinstance(obj, (datetime.date, datetime.datetime)): 
 533              obj = obj.isoformat()[:10] 
 534          else: 
 535              obj = str(obj) 
 536          if dbname in ['oracle', 'informix']:

1352 -    def executesql(self, query, placeholders=None, as_dict=False): 

1353          """ 
1354          placeholders is optional and will always be None when using DAL 
1355          if using raw SQL with placeholders, placeholders may be 
1356          a sequence of values to be substituted in 
1357          or, *if supported by the DB driver*, a dictionary with keys 
1358          matching named placeholders in your SQL. 
1359   
1360          Added 2009-12-05 "as_dict" optional argument. Will always be 
1361          None when using DAL. If using raw SQL can be set to True 
1362          and the results cursor returned by the DB driver will be 
1363          converted to a sequence of dictionaries keyed with the db 
1364          field names. Tested with SQLite but should work with any database 
1365          since the cursor.description used to get field names is part of the 
1366          Python dbi 2.0 specs. Results returned with as_dict = True are 
1367          the same as those returned when applying .to_list() to a DAL query. 
1368   
1369          [{field1: value1, field2: value2}, {field1: value1b, field2: value2b}] 
1370   
1371          --bmeredyk 
1372          """ 
1373          self['_lastsql'] = query 
1374          if placeholders: 
1375              self['_lastsql'] +="  with "+str(placeholders) 
1376              self._execute(query, placeholders) 
1377          else: 
1378              self._execute(query) 
1379          if as_dict: 
1380              if not hasattr(self._cursor,'description'): 
1381                  raise RuntimeError, "database does not support executesql(...,as_dict=True)" 
1382              # Non-DAL legacy db query, converts cursor results to dict. 
1383              # sequence of 7-item sequences. each sequence tells about a column. 
1384              # first item is always the field name according to Python Database API specs 
1385              columns = self._cursor.description 
1386              # reduce the column info down to just the field names 
1387              fields = [f[0] for f in columns] 
1388              # will hold our finished resultset in a list 
1389              data = self._cursor.fetchall() 
1390              # convert the list for each row into a dictionary so it's 
1391              # easier to work with. row['field_name'] rather than row[0] 
1392              return [dict(zip(fields,row)) for row in data] 
1393          # see if any results returned from database 
1394          try: 
1395              return self._cursor.fetchall() 
1396          except: 
1397              return None
